sponsor.partnerMessage: Emcar Stone Studio is a family-owned and operated full-service fabrication and installation company servicing NWA that specializes in residential/commercial: quartz, granite, marble, and quartzite countertops. Contact them today for a complimentary quote!

posts.title: Crystal Bridges Hosts Northwest Arkansas Fashion Week
posts.photoCredit: Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art
posts.content:
Northwest Arkansas Fashion Week, presented by INTERFORM, will culminate in a one-day event at Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art this Saturday, Nov 12. 

  • Talk the talk: Designers from the EMERGE Designer Residency program and museum scholars will lead public presentations and panel discussions in the Great Hall and on Walker Landing from 1-4p on Saturday. 
  • Walk the walk: In the evening, models will strike signature poses and strut their stuff down the catwalk during exclusive ticketed runway shows, and there will be an immersive VIP Experience in the Great Hall.

Get your tickets for the runway show HERE.

posts.title: Arkansas Women’s Basketball Opens 2022-23 Season At Pine Bluff Tonight
posts.content:
Arkansas Women’s Basketball will face the UAPB Golden Lions tonight at 6p at H.O. Clemmons Arena in Pine Bluff. 

  • Firsts: This will be the first time an Arkansas Women’s Basketball team has ever played at UAPB, and the 4,100-person arena is sold out!
  • Rematch: Last year’s matchup with UAPB at Bud Walton resulted in a 96-63 win for the Lady Razorbacks, led by Wolfenbarger’s 15 points and seven rebounds. 

Find more information about the game HERE.

posts.title: Secondhand Smoke Serving The Community With Love And BBQ
posts.content:
Do South Magazine featured a story on Nate Walls, owner of Secondhand Smoke, a Fayetteville-based BBQ caterer with a mission to serve the community. 

  • Bring it to the table: Walls shared about the ups and downs of his past and commented on the power of food on a table to bring people together for reflection, support, and nourishment for the soul. 
  • Feed people: When COVID shut things down, Walls used the last of the company’s resources to distribute meals door-to-door around the community, not realizing this would turn into Second Helping NWA, a nonprofit to which he dedicates three days a week to feed the community. 

Read Nate Wall’s inspiring story HERE.

posts.title: Thaden School Accepting Applications For Next School Year
posts.content:
Applications for admission to Thaden School for the 2023-24 academic year are now open. Priority is given to applicants who complete the process by January, and applications submitted after will be considered on a rolling basis if space is available. 

  • Ready to fly: Thaden School aims to ignite a passion for discovery and learning, preparing students for future success by inspiring them to lead lives of integrity, purpose, and responsible global citizenship. 
  • Recognition: Though only founded in 2017, Thaden is already the #1 ranked independent school in Arkansas serving 6-12th grade students. 

Begin your Thaden journey by applying HERE.

posts.title: Startup Village Provides Co-Working Space For University Student-led Businesses
posts.content:
Three U of A student-led startups are currently participating in Startup Village, a free co-working space in downtown Fayetteville joined through a competitive annual membership application process. 

  • New kids: New to the space are startups Nayari Skin Care, a vegan-based skincare line founded by Warrenesha Arnold, and Crimson Fox Design Co, founded by graphic design student Grace Underfanger. 
  • Welcoming committee: Already in the space was Rejoicy, co-founded by alumni Luke Brown and Edwin Ortiz, which provides business owners with ways to create quick and affordable websites.

Read more about the exciting things happening at Startup Village HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Woman up: Give your startup the boost it needs by applying for the 2023 EMPOWER Cohort, offered to all women by Startup Junkie and Science Venture Studio.* 
  • Pickin time: The Ozark Folk Festival kicks off this weekend, Nov 10-12, bringing three days of the best regional and national folk music to the Aud in Eureka Spring.* 
  • Seniority: The Adult Wellness Center in Rogers hosts a variety of awesome activities and classes for people aged 50+.
  • Football for everyone: 4029 News featured this elementary's after-school program that helps children with special needs play sports through inclusive flag football.
  • Tell it: Have a story? We have room in the newsletter for you! Check out our deals HERE.

*Content is sponsored
